name: misinterpret
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C2 to form an understanding that is not correct of something that is said or done: My speech has been misinterpreted by the press. When we re-examined the regulations, we realized that we had misinterpreted them. Synonym
misconstrue formal

to not understand or explain something correctly: She felt that her comments had been misinterpreted. misinterpretation noun [ C/U ] us/ˌmɪs·ɪnˌtɜr·prəˈteɪ·ʃən/
[ C ] If a patient isn’t honest, that can lead to misinterpretations of what is wrong with her.
